intro: Hedyotis acuminata f. koolauensis, commonly known as the Koolau endemic strobilanthes, is a rare plant species native to Hawaii. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
